Package com.zoho.arattai.Core

Class WhatsAppChatParser

java.lang.Object
com.zoho.arattai.Core.WhatsAppChatParser
public class WhatsAppChatParser extends Object
Stateless parser for WhatsApp chat export ZIP files.

Call parse(String) with the path to a .zip file exported from WhatsApp. The parser indexes all media entries in the archive and then reads the chat transcript line by line, producing a WhatsAppExport containing typed Message subclass instances.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Zoho Arattai

  • Method Details

    • parse

      public static WhatsAppExport parse(String zipFilePath) throws IOException
      Parses a WhatsApp export ZIP file and returns a structured representation of the chat.

      The process involves:

      1. Extracting the chat name from the filename.
      2. Indexing all media files present in the archive.
      3. Reading the .txt transcript file and parsing message content.
      Parameters:
      zipFilePath - absolute path to the WhatsApp export .zip file
      Returns:
      a WhatsAppExport instance containing the chat name and all parsed messages
      Throws:
      IOException - if the ZIP file cannot be read or is missing a transcript

    • parseTranscript

      public static List<Message> parseTranscript(BufferedReader reader, Map<String,WhatsAppChatParser.MediaEntry> mediaFiles, ZipFile zipFile) throws IOException
      Reads the chat transcript text and splits it into discrete Message objects.

      This method handles multi-line messages by buffering lines until a new message timestamp header is encountered.

      Parameters:
      reader - reader for the transcript .txt file
      mediaFiles - map of indexed media entries from the ZIP archive
      zipFile - the open ZIP file instance for reading media metadata
      Returns:
      a list of parsed Message objects
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs while reading the transcript

    • buildMessage

      public static Message buildMessage(String rawLine, Map<String,WhatsAppChatParser.MediaEntry> mediaFiles, ZipFile zipFile)
      Constructs a Message object from a raw block of text representing a single message.

      The method extracts the sender, timestamp, and message content using refined regex patterns. It then determines the message type and links any associated media files.

      Parameters:
      rawLine - the full text block (one or more lines) for a single message
      mediaFiles - map of indexed media entries
      zipFile - the open ZIP file instance
      Returns:
      a specific Message subclass (e.g., TextMessage, ImageMessage) or null if the line header is invalid

    • classifyMessage

      public static Message.MessageType classifyMessage(String content)
      Determines the Message.MessageType based on the text content of a message.

      WhatsApp marks attachments with a specific "(file attached)" suffix or provides cues like "<Media omitted>". This method uses these cues along with file extension matching to classify the message.

      Parameters:
      content - the text content of the message
      Returns:
      estimated Message.MessageType

    • findMedia

      public static WhatsAppChatParser.MediaEntry findMedia(String content, Map<String,WhatsAppChatParser.MediaEntry> mediaFiles, String type)
      Searches the indexed media files for an entry that matches the filename mentioned in the message content.
      Parameters:
      content - the message text content containing the media hint
      mediaFiles - map of all file entries in the ZIP
      type - the expected category (image, video, etc.) used to narrow extension matching
      Returns:
      the matching WhatsAppChatParser.MediaEntry or null if no match is found

    • parseOpusDuration

      public static String parseOpusDuration(File file)
      Parses the duration of an Opus-encoded OGG file (WhatsApp voice note).

      Reads the last OGG page from the end of the file to extract the total granule position, which represents the playback time.

      Parameters:
      file - the temp file containing the opus audio
      Returns:
      formatted duration string (e.g., "0:45")

    • parseMp4Duration

      public static String parseMp4Duration(File file)
      Parses the duration of an MP4 container (video or AAC audio).

      Scans for the mvhd atom to extract the timescale and total duration values.

      Parameters:
      file - the temp file to parse
      Returns:
      formatted duration string (e.g., "1:30")

    • parseMp4Dimensions

      public static int[] parseMp4Dimensions(File file)
      Parses the width and height of an MP4 video file.

      Scans for the tkhd atom and reads the dimension fields.

      Parameters:
      file - the temp file to parse
      Returns:
      an array containing {width, height}

    • extractToTemp

      public static File extractToTemp(ZipFile zf, ZipEntry ze, String prefix, String ext) throws IOException
      Copies a file from the ZIP archive to a temporary file on disk.

      This is required by media libraries that need random access to the file (like mp3agic or certain MP4 box parsers).

      Parameters:
      zf - the source ZIP file
      ze - the specific entry to extract
      prefix - temp file prefix
      ext - temp file extension
      Returns:
      a File object for the temporary on-disk copy
      Throws:
      IOException - if copying fails

    • extension

      public static String extension(String f)
      Utility to extract the file extension from a filename.
      Parameters:
      f - filename
      Returns:
      extension in lowercase, or "unknown" if no dot exists

    • extractChatName

      public static String extractChatName(String p)
      Simplifies the ZIP filename to use as the chat name.
      Parameters:
      p - path or filename of the ZIP
      Returns:
      cleaned chat name

    • parseTimestamp

      public static Date parseTimestamp(String raw)
      Parses a WhatsApp message timestamp string into a Date object.
      Parameters:
      raw - the raw timestamp string from the text file
      Returns:
      matching Date, or current time if parsing fails
